summary: This is an email forwarding Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team's response to the government's motion to preclude expert testimony from Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus in her criminal case. It shows the submission of sealed legal documents to the court.

persons.name: Nicole Simmon
persons.context: Sends the email attaching Maxwell's legal response to the court, working at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Addressed as 'Judge Nathan', the recipient of the legal filing in the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Requested the submission of Maxwell's response to the court's motion.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the legal submission.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330, whose legal team is submitting a response to exclude expert testimony.

persons.name: Park Dietz
persons.context: A proposed expert witness whose testimony the government seeks to preclude.

persons.name: Elizabeth Loftus
persons.context: A proposed expert witness whose testimony the government seeks to preclude.

connections.description: Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, requesting submission of legal documents on her behalf.
Menninger is copied on legal correspondence regarding Maxwell's case.
Simmon sends the filing at Pagliuca's request, indicating they work together on Maxwell's defense.
Dietz is a proposed expert witness for Maxwell's defense team.
Loftus is a proposed expert witness for Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Response to Motion to Preclude Experts
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a response opposing the government's motion to exclude testimony from expert witnesses Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team opposed the government's motion to preclude expert testimony from Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus.
The legal documents were submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.
The correspondence shows the procedural steps in Maxwell's criminal case (20 Cr. 330) regarding expert witness testimony.
